title: Additional method 'expectExactMessage(String)' in class 'ExpectedException'
Unnecessary array in varargs in AnnotatedBuildrer
body:
A simple improvement. The IDE highlights two lines in `AnnotatedBuildrer` that an array in varargs is not necessary.
Reason is that `Constructor#newInstance(Object ... initargs)` really does not need any array in source code.

title: TestCase setup() exception causes tearDown() to not be called
Parametrized runner for tests with one parameter
body:
Usually i write parametrized tests with only one input parameter. So, using the Collection \<Object[]\> return type for my data() method and conversion from one-dimensional collection to two-dimensional looks like overkill.

It would be nice to be able annotate with @Parameters method, which returns Collection\<Object\>.

What do you think about this idea? If it's ok, i'll implement it.

title: Added BND plugin in pom.xml
body:
Added BND plugin in build file pom.xml which creates additional osgi headers in MANIFEST.MF.
Forged from #472 leaving the integration tests in #472.

title: Support more return types for the @Parameters method. Fixes #700.
body: Support the return types Iterator<? extends Object>, Object[] and Object[][]. You don't have to wrap arrays with Iterables and single parameters with Object arrays.

title: Java 8 Compatibility [Enhancement] - not an issue!
body:
As part of the Adopt OpenJDK project, we have been building Java opensource projects using the EA release of Java 8 (from http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/ea-jsp-142245.html) and found that JUnit built without issues.

As a bonus you can add the below image to any JUnit assets - github readme or website:
https://java.net/downloads/adoptopenjdk/compat.svg

Have a look at a sample usage to see what I mean:
https://github.com/neomatrix369/RESTAPIUnifier/blob/master/README.md

- Adopt OpenJDK volunteer.

title: Separate junit.framework.Assert to separate module
body:
This is more of an optimization request.

I am constantly importing junit.framework.Assert, instead of org.junit.Assert, and spend time on fixing it. Although this is specific, and can be managed on IDE level, support for junit.framework package causes constant misleads on my side. So can you move it to separate project, or remove it from future releases

title: Badge Java 8 Compatible !
body:
Feedback from Adopt OpenJDK Team:

https://java.net/projects/adoptopenjdk/pages/TestingJava8

title: New Method Proposal: ExpectedException#expect(Throwable, Callable)
body:
Many times I needed to assert a block of code in test-method to throw an exception, and check how the throwing block has changed values.
I had to use try-catch.

So I would like to implement new method with such of signature `ExpectedException#expect(Throwable, Callable)`.

Usage:

`Object obj = expect( Exception.class ,  new Callable() { ..do and return something.. });`

Usage of Lambda in Java 8:

`expect( Exception.class ,  () -> { ..do and return something.. }  )`

title: org.junit.Assert assertEquals Bug introduced in 4.11
body:
The following line works in 4.10, however not in 4.11

Assert.assertEquals(0.0f,0.0f,0.00000001f);

to make it work one needs to change it to:
Assert.assertEquals(0.0f,0.0f,0.00000001);

There is also no correct error generated and no hint given want went wrong...

Even if the assertEquals(float,float,float) seems not to be documentend anymore:
http://junit.sourceforge.net/javadoc/org/junit/Assert.html

the method is still available and not deprecated in 4.11:
http://grepcode.com/file/repo1.maven.org/maven2/junit/junit/4.11/org/junit/Assert.java?av=f#600

Update: Corrected the code link

title: Fix for issue #687: handle AssertionErrors and AssumptionViolatedExceptions by default again
body: Change the default behaviour of the `ExpectedException` rule back to handling `AssertionError`s and `AssumptionViolatedException`s by default to fix issue #687, i.e. one does not have to call `ExpectedException#handleAssertionErrors()` or `ExpectedException#handleAssumptionViolatedExceptions()` to make the rule handle those exceptions.

title: Enclosed-Runner tries to run all enclosed classes
body:
Hi,

the Enclosed-Runner tries to run all contained Classes of the annotated enclosing class.

Abstract classes or classes with protected constructor should not be run, since  they mostly are used as base-classes for the other enclosed classes to share methods or instance-variables.

title: JUnit Tests are running concurrently
body:
I'm logging the string "starting test <method name>", and "done running <method name>" on the first and last line of everyone of my test methods.

The first few entries in the log file are fine, but after that they start mixing them selves up...

Any help/pointers would be greatly appreciated.

title: Introduce ExpectedException.expectRootCause
body:
Right now you can only check/expect the direct cause of an exception that is thrown in a test method.
I have an arquillian test where I need to check the root(!) cause (a ConstraintViolationException) which "is on 4th level" (wrapped three times by the container).

So an new Method "public void expectRootCause(Matcher<? extends Throwable> expectedCause) {" would come in handy!

title: Re #686: Added thread safety warnings to @Test javadoc.
body: Added requested thready safety warnings, both to the description of the timeout parameter at the top of the javadoc, and at the description of the timeout parameter at the bottom

title: Delete .cvsignore files, because we're using Git now.
Exception assertions improvement.
Properly handle case where filter removes all JUnit3 tests in suite.
body:
Before this change, description.testCount() would count methods
which should be removed by intersection of filters.

title: Refactoring of TestClassTest, and adding 2 new test cases.
body:
This pull requests contains some improvements to the test cases for `org.junit.runners.model.TestClass`.

These test cases are included in the only file changed by this pull request, `org.junit.tests.running.classes.TestClassTest`.

The test cases here make use of static classes, which act as the fixtures for this test class.

One of the obvious improvements was to remove the static class `ManyMethods`, as it was not used in any test method.

Furthermore, when closely examining the full test class, I noticed that it was fairly incomplete. For example, the (fairly tricky) methods `getAnnotatedFieldValues` and `getAnnotatedMethodValues` were not tested, which are now provided.

The new tests make use of two new static fixture classes. These each contain two fields / methods (one matching, and one not matching the criterion) to exercise all the branches in the methods under test.

This class under test was originally mainly [tested indirectly](http://xunitpatterns.com/Obscure%20Test.html#Indirect Testing), with incomplete branch coverage. The new test cases serve to better document the behavior of this class.
